column2: Tindak Malaysia (2024), State of Sabah Government Gazette 1st April 1967 (for Contested Candidate Names), State of Sabah Government Gazette 10th May 1967 (for Uncontested Candidate Names and Election Results). Refer to 1967_Other_Sources for other source files

Constituency Codes and Names as per Sabah first delineation report (Government Gazettes indicate constituency code as S.1, S.2, etc). Government Gazette spells Bengkoka-Banggi as Bengkokka-Banggi and spells Pensiangan-Sook as Pensiangan Sook. Government Gazette has wrong values for Total Ballots Issued for Constituencies of Bengkoka- Banggi, Labuan, Pensiangan-Sook, Ranau, Sandakan Bandar and Lamag. There may be a presence for missing data points for age attribute for candidates. Sabah Alliance parties contested among themselves. Following are the SCA Candidates who used Alliance (Perikatan) flag instead of SCA - DATO PHANG THET TSUNG, KHOO SIAK CHIEW, MR. PETER LO SU YIN and CHAN FOO SANG. No information available on candidates losing deposit. TindakMalaysia Network Services PLT is not responsible for any errors or ommissions arising from the original data or its derivatives.
Composite between Parliamentary Code and DUN Code (Unique Identifier).
Party/Coalition (with Component Party) who won the seat
Indicator if there was one contestant for the said election. If yes, value Y is affixed. If none, it is left blank
The difference between the highest valid votes and second highest valid votes
Proportion of Total Ballots Issued as a share of Total Electorate
Total number of ballot papers used at the poll (excluding spoiled ballot papers)
Total number of ballot papers issued but not put in the ballot box and not returned (no information is available)
Total number of rejected ballot papers
Total number of votes by electors
Sabah Alliance Valid Vote for the Candidate
Indicated if the contestant has lost deposit. If yes, value 'Loss Deposit' is affixed. For Sabah, no information is available
